channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Is the future of work waiting down the block?
item.description: Up until very recently, employees often had to endure costly and lengthy commutes to faraway cities to work from a single headquarters office on a dai...

item.title: Former Siemens and Alcoa CEO Klaus Kleinfeld dismisses the idea of work-life separation: ‘You are one person’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: This new technology could help reduce speeding-related deaths

item.title: Target Just Made an Announcement That Investors Hate. It Did the Right Thing
item.description: When Target announced that COO Michael Fiddelke will replace CEO Brian Cornell, stock prices plummeted. Wall Street is wrong.

item.title: Some pro athletes get better with age. High-pressure environments are rewiring their brains
item.description: In a world where sports are dominated by youth and speed, some athletes in their late 30s and even 40s are not just keeping up—they are thriving. Nova...

item.title: 5 hacks for helping working parents reduce the mental load

item.title: Want to Know How Long You’ll Live? Science Says These Simple Tests Predict Lifespan (and Assess Your Current Overall Health)
item.description: Best of all, each provides a path towards increasing your longevity and improving your overall health.

item.title: Trump’s 19-year war on wind power is ‘weaponizing bureaucracy to undermine American energy production,’ critics say
item.description: Trump is tying wind and solar projects up in ever-increasing bureaucratic layers and reviews while expediting fossil fuels.

item.description: DeepSeek is forcing the U.S.–China AI rivalry into sharper focus and may put OpenAI on the back foot following its disappointing GPT-5 launch.

item.title: A New Kind of Labubu Is Launching, Bringing Pop Mart Closer to $4 Billion in Revenue
item.description: The Chinese toymaker is capitalizing on the runaway success of its ugly-cute Labubu dolls.

item.title: Target Just Changed Its Leadership. Some Say It’s Not a Great Sign
item.description: After the company announced its next CEO, shares of the Minneapolis-based retailer dropped.

item.title: Your Employees Can Now Vibe Code With Anthropic’s Claude, for a Price
item.description: Anthropic is bringing Claude Code to its Teams and Enterprise plans.

item.title: The white-collar job market is frozen—now bartenders and baristas are seeing bigger wage growth than desk workers
item.description: Gen Zers who are lucky enough to get an office job: Don’t expect a raise.

item.title: Bitcoin dips ahead of Fed chair’s remarks at Jackson Hole
item.description: The world’s largest cryptocurrency is down almost 5% after notching an all-time high one week ago.

item.title: Stocks may need ‘tariff checks’ to keep rallying — but bonds wouldn’t like it
Rotation out of Big Tech sends S&P 500 skidding. How long will it last?
